title: Ticket #4353: DAG-level disabling of node job log files
description:
Add a new DAGMan configuration knob (maybe DAGMAN_SUPPRESS_JOB_LOG) that, if enabled and DAGMan is running in workflow log mode, suppresses logging to the log file defined in node job submit files.

(This is so LIGO can prevent the schedd from writing to log files on NFS, which slows down the schedd too much.)
remarks:
2014-May-08 14:49:39 by wenger:
More details from #4335, which is basically a duplicate of this:

Create DAGMAN_SUPPRESS_JOB_LOG, default to False. If (DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG != Undefined && DAGMAN_SUPPRESS_JOB_LOG) Then "Do not write to log defined in node job submit file."

This avoids the problem of defining a log for the purpose non-DAG testing/use, but forgetting to remove it during DAG submission.

(Note: config macro name could be different -- I haven't thought about that yet.)

2014-Aug-12 14:31:50 by wenger:
In the LIGO call today, Tom said that this feature isn't super-useful to them without #4334 (Add owner macro to DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG configuration). I think I'm going to go ahead and implement this one, because it's pretty well-defined, and we need a little clarification on #4334.
